poem:
**The Salt Path**  

Two souls barefoot on the cusp of land,  
line by line, crag and salt air weaving  
the tale of paper-thin survival—fractured,  
each step, a thread spun by sea wind.  
In rain and ruin, they find solace  
in strangers' hands, paths entwined  
on the cliff's edge, truth or not—  
a journey mapped by hope alone.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Whatever the truth of The Salt Path, I know why people wanted to believe it | Gaby Hinsliff Was the story always, in hindsight, just a little too good to be true? A middle-aged couple, brutally down on their luck after bankruptcy and a terminal diagnosis, escape their troubles on an epic walk round the South West Coast Path, finding comfort along the way in the kindness of strangers. Billed as an “honest and life-affirming”". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
